text: Madison County is a county in the U.S. state of Mississippi. As of the 2020 census, 109,145 people lived there. Its county seat is Canton. The county is named for James Madison, 4th President of the United States (1809â€“1817). == References == Category:1820s establishments in Mississippi Category:1828 establishments in the United States Category:Mississippi counties
title: Madison County, Mississippi
